verse: The Lord proclaims: I have returned to Zion; I will settle in Jerusalem. Jerusalem will be called the city of truth; the mountain of the Lord of heavenly forces will be the holy mountain.
The city will be full of boys and girls playing in its plazas.
I’ll bring them back so they will dwell in Jerusalem. They will be my people, and I will be their God—in truth and in righteousness.
Before this time, there were no wages for people or animals; there was no relief from distress about going out or coming in, because I set everyone against their own neighbor.
But now, unlike those earlier days, I’ll be with the few remaining among this people, says the Lord of heavenly forces.
so now I have changed course and again plan to do good to Jerusalem and the house of Judah. Don’t be afraid.
These are the things you should do: Speak the truth to each other; make truthful, just, and peaceable decisions within your gates.
Don’t plan evil for each other. Don’t adore swearing falsely, for all of these are things that I hate, says the Lord.
The inhabitants of one city will go to another saying, “Let’s go and seek the favor of the Lord, and look for the Lord of heavenly forces. I’m going too.”
Many peoples and mighty nations will come to seek the Lord of heavenly forces in Jerusalem and to seek the favor of the Lord.
